column5: WOW there were a lot of people out there today chucking lures... from both shore and boat. Picked this one up 15 minutes into the day. Very clean pike! Ended up being 31" and is my personal best so far. Nothing amazing. My girlfriend still has me beat as hers is 33" from last year Was the only fish we managed to see aside from one caught from a boat. No follows at all... which is weird for me.     Admiring a beautiful predator.   Back where it belongs.
Like that last shot !  glad to see you got out . Hope to do thE same this weeK  TB
Great shots and nice fish!  Love that last pic too...can just see the swish of it's tail!
love the pictures !  congrats on the openner!
Well done frozen-fire. Nice clean and healthy looking pike. Great release shots. What did you catch it on?
congrats on your PB!!!
Great stuff, absolutely loving those pictures....specially the last one for me too.  Thanks for sharing.
Hey Jedi, pike was caught on a hot steel x-rap. Love the colours! Seemed like half the people there were using clown... decided to switch it up and try something new

nice fish i wasnt lucky enough to get into any at all today.  tried bayfront park in hamilton and the bridge down by valley in road in hamilton/burlington.  the wind was killer and the water was all muddy.  gonna try and get out tomorrow too for a bit, hopefully its a little more comfortable out.  ryan
thanks for releasing .....why man invented the camera!
Good one, like the pictures, thanks...

Hell of a day forsure lookin to get out to toronto island today if i can find somone to head out with. I have a bassboat and have never launched in toronto or fished the island, Next time you head out drop me a pm !!!
nice
Nice little toothy critter there!  great job!
WTG, you took some beautiful pics there!
great looking fish-congrats
good job!! very nice fish and a nice day to boot!!!
Thanks guys!
Great Pike man, I sure would of liked to catch one of those today.  Thanks for sharing, Mike

Did the same and a few other spots around Hamilton.  Complete blank, no follows.......not even a sheepie.  Water was alot murkier at Bayfront than it usually is, but temp was good.  Even Hot Steel drew a blank in Steeltown.    Remember to operate a boat in TO you need a Harbour License. http://www.torontoport.com/PortAuthority/p...rmits_intro.asp
Congrats stout fellow...Great pics and very nice fish  Especially love the release shots.
Great job frozen-fire    Beauty gator Leechman
nice job.. think we were fishin the shore opposite from you most of the morning..  everyone was using that clown xrap..
